title: Can anyone ID this movie poster font please ?
content:
[http://nofatclips.com/02008/08/18/war/index\_01.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122102915/http:/nofatclips.com/02008/08/18/war/index_01.jpg "http://nofatclips.com/02008/08/18/war/index\_01.jpg")

I particularly want to know the font that is used for “A VINCENT CHAI FILM” and the part that says “WORLD WAR”.

Thanks in advance.

 [‹ Gothic for peace, justice, etc.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122102915/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48496 "Go to previous forum topic") [BODY TEXT FOR GOLF MAGAZINE ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122102915/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48537 "Go to next forum topic")
author: devante

comments.content: Thank you for the speedy reply. I appreciate it.
Also...the font used for the “WORLD WAR” looks 3-D. What font is that ? Or is there some way to make the text 3\_D like that ?

“Also...the font used for the “WORLD WAR” looks 3-D. What font is that ?”

It doesn’t work that way.

“Or is there some way to make the text 3\_D like that ?”

That lloks like some beveling, embossing, and texturizing done in Photoshop. Done badly, mind you. Special effects do not make for good design by themselves. I suggest you avoid it.
